definitions: To dissolve out soluble constituents from (ash, soil, or other material) by percolation.
To drain away from soil, ash, or similar material by the action of percolating liquid.
To extract or remove (a soluble substance) from a material by the action of a percolating liquid.
To gradually deplete or drain away resources, strength, or vitality.
examples: Rainwater can leach nutrients from the soil.
The toxins leached into the groundwater.
The constant demands leached his energy.
